title: Views are updated twice, which is slow

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

I am installing a set of packages via an environment. This environment also defines a view. This view is updated twice in a row instead of only once. Since I'm on an HPC system, updating the view is very slow.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack --env-dir utils/spack/symmetry-llvm/compilers install --fail-fast
```

My `spack.yaml` is:
```yaml
spack:
  specs:
    - 'gcc @11.1.0 +graphite'
    - 'llvm @12.0.0 +flang'
  concretization: together
  view: /home/eschnetter/src/CarpetX/Cactus/view-compilers-llvm
```

### Error Message

Note the duplicate message about `Updating view` at the end. The first update takes several minutes, the second about one minute.

I usually run separate concretization step before (`spack --env-dir utils/spack/symmetry/compilers concretize --force`). This also updates the view (which is useless since the packages haven't been built yet), and which is also slow. It seems Spack just likes updating views.
